subject: Re: [junit] Installing junit3.8.1 question
msgSnippet: Hi, Thanks for your advice. On Sat, 26 Jun 2004 11:48:58 -0700, Ray has advised me on his posting to carry out following steps - snip - ... Those look like
messageBody:
Hi,

Thanks for your advice.

On Sat, 26 Jun 2004 11:48:58 -0700, Ray has advised me
on his posting to carry out following steps

- snip -

>>>
Those look like windoze instructions, on linux you
will not need the set unless you are in some very
strange shell, and the path separator is ':' not ';'
(which terminates a command), and and the '\'s need
to change into '/'s. Also, on linux, it's CLASSPATH.
So it should be:
CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:INSTALL_DIR/junit3/junit.jar

> # set
classpath=%classpath%;home\user-admin\Junit\junit3.8.1\junit.jar

again, try:
CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:home/user-admin/Junit/junit3.8.1/junit.jar
<<<

However on
http://junit.sourceforge.net/README.html#Installation

it did not mention that is for Windoz. Curiosity
pushed me to ask Ray again.

B.R.
satimis


--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote: >

> > I failed to locate the manual for installing junit
> > 3.8.1 on Linux
>
> Please do not take this the wrong way. This may seem
> harsh, and that's
> not my intention.
>
> There is no manual for installing JUnit, because it
> would have only one
> line:
>
> 1. Add junit.jar to your classpath.
>
> The assumption is that the reader already knows how
> to put a .jar file
> on the classpath, since that's beginner Java
> information.
>
> That's why there is no manual.
>
> Best of luck.
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
